alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clay; Nuckolls; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 6:52PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Clay, western Nuckolls, eastern Webster and southeastern Adams Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 652 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rosemont to near Lawrence to Bostwick. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nelson, Fairfield, Lawrence, Guide Rock, Deweese, Bostwick and Rosemont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
